p: At the end of 2019, the novel Betacoronavirus, Severe Acute Respiratory Syndrome coronavirus 2 (SARS-CoV-2), crossed the animal-human barrier resulting in a public health emergency of international concern and a global pandemic [ 1]. With the Severe Acute Respiratory Syndrome coronavirus (SARS-CoV) in 2002/2003 and the Middle East Respiratory Syndrome coronavirus (MERS-CoV) in 2012, this is the third time within the last 20Â years that Betacoronaviruses have crossed the animal-human species barrier resulting in major zoonotic outbreaks [ 2].
